summary.para: This is the time that the user last logged into the domain.
Whenever a user logs on, the value of this attribute is read from the DC.
If the value is older [ current_time - msDS-LogonTimeSyncInterval ], the value is updated.
The initial update after the raise of the domain functional level
is calculated as 14 days minus random percentage of 5 days.

summary.para: Gets the LastLogonTimestamp time of the user.
This is the time that the user last logged into the domain.
Whenever a user logs on, the value of this attribute is read from the DC.
If the value is older [ current_time - msDS-LogonTimeSyncInterval ], the value is updated.
The initial update after the raise of the domain functional level
is calculated as 14 days minus random percentage of 5 days.

param.para: Office Id for the users
Returns all users that have an office id that begins with the specified criteria.
EX: PA012 will return users for PA012-100 and PA012-200
Defaults to returning Enabled User Accounts
To filter by Enabled, Disabled, User Accounts or Service Accounts, use the overloaded method to pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

member.name: M:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.GetUsersByName(System.String)

summary.para: Gets User data from the Directory
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter
Defaults to returning Enabled User Accounts
To filter by Enabled, Disabled, User Accounts or Service Accounts, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: lastName
param.para: Last Name of the user
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
Ex: Setting the LastName to "Anders" will find "Anderson" and "Andersen"
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

member.returns: List of DirectoryUser objects containing the data, or Null if not found

member.name: M:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.GetUsersByName(System.String,CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.DirectoryUserFilter)

summary.para: Gets User data from the Directory
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
Ex: Setting the LastName to "Anders" will find "Anderson" and "Andersen"
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter
Defaults to returning Enabled User Accounts
To filter by Enabled, Disabled, User Accounts or Service Accounts, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: lastName
param.para: Last Name of the user
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
Ex: Setting the LastName to "Anders" will find "Anderson" and "Andersen"
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: directoryUserFilter
param.para: Allows you to filter user accounts to return Enabled or Disabled User and Service accounts, or users with last names that start with or an an exact match to the lastName parameter
Allows you to filter users that start with, or are an exact match to the characters specified in the last name

member.returns: List of DirectoryUser objects containing the data, or Null if not found

member.name: M:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.GetUsersByName(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Gets User data from the Directory
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
Ex: Setting the LastName to "Anders" will find "Anderson" and "Andersen"
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter
Defaults to returning Enabled User Accounts
To filter by Enabled, Disabled, User Accounts or Service Accounts, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: lastName
param.para: Last Name of the user
Defaults to match accounts that start with the characters specified in the last name
Ex: Setting the LastName to "Anders" will find "Anderson" and "Andersen"
To filter by an exact match for last name, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: firstName
param.para: First Name of the user
Will match any accounts that begin with the characters specified in the first name
Ex: Setting the FirstName to "Chris" will find "Chris", "Christine" and "Christopher"
To omit using the First Name as part of the match criteria, pass in 'null' or an emptry string

param.name: middleName
param.para: Middle Name of the user
Generally speaking, the Directory only contains the first letter of the middle name
Will match any accounts that begin with the characters specified in the middle name
Ex: Setting the MiddleName to "J" will find "J", "John" and "Joseph"
To omit using the Middle Name as part of the match criteria, pass in 'null' or an empty string

member.returns: List of DirectoryUser objects containing the data, or Null if not found

member.name: M:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.GetUsersByName(System.String,System.String,System.String,CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.DirectoryUserFilter)

Defaults to returning Enabled User Accounts
To filter by Enabled, Disabled, User Accounts or Service Accounts, pass in a DirectoryUserFilter

param.name: lastName

To omit using the First Name as part of the match criteria, pass in 'null' or an emptry string

param.name: middleName

Generally speaking, the Directory only contains the first letter of the middle name

Ex: Setting the MiddleName to "J" will find "J", "John" and "Joseph"

param.name: directoryUserFilter
param.para: Allows you to filter user accounts to return Enabled or Disabled User and Service accounts, or users with last names that start with or an an exact match to the lastName parameter

member.name: P:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.SizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum number of objects that the server returns in a search.
member.exception: The new value is less than zero.
member.remarks: The maximum number of objects that the server returns in a search. The default value is zero, which means to use the server-determined size limit which is 5000 for UHG AD servers. To retrieve more than 5000 records, set the PageSize value and all records will be returned in pages. NOTE: SizeLimit is ignored if PageSize is set.

member.name: P:CloudSdk.DirectoryServices.CloudSdkDirectory.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum number of objects that the server returns in a paged search.
member.exception: The new value is less than zero.
member.remarks: The maximum number of objects that the server returns in a paged search. The default value is zero, which means do not do a paged search. NOTE: A paged search is handled behind the scenes. SizeLimit is ignored if PageSize is set.

member.summary: Transaction end. Logged by Layer 7 DMZ Gateway for APIs

member.name: F:CloudSdk.Logging.Resiliency.CloudSdkResiliencyEventCode.R02_iDomain_Request
member.summary: For the transaction, Request to resources which are internal to the application (i.e. within application domain)

member.summary: Response from resources which are shared or cross domain (i.e. external to the application)

member.name: F:CloudSdk.Logging.Resiliency.CloudSdkResiliencyEventCode.R02_iDomain_Response
member.summary: Request from resources which are internal to the application (i.e. within application domain)

member.summary: Resiliency Pattern: Circuit Breaker Open

member.name: F:CloudSdk.Logging.Resiliency.CloudSdkResiliencyEventCode.R03_CircuitBreaker_Close
member.summary: Resiliency Pattern: Circuit Breaker close

member.summary: Resiliency Pattern: Governor Open

member.summary: Resiliency Pattern: Governor close

member.name: F:CloudSdk.Logging.Resiliency.CloudSdkResiliencyEventCode.R04
member.summary: These are Fatal Errors where a Component maybe unavailable (cannot be reached), transaction failed and cannot be recovered. Identifying and logging R04 events is owned by the application team. These will be displayed separately in the dashboard.

member.name: F:CloudSdk.Logging.Resiliency.CloudSdkResiliencyEventCode.R05
member.summary: Any other type of errors which have major impact on the service to be closely monitored and tracked. Identifying and logging R05 is owned by the application team. These will be displayed separately in the dashboard. R05 events are optional.
